name: blephilia hirsuta
description:
Blephilia hirsuta prefers moist woods and savannas. Its white two-lipped flowers are packed in tight clusters stacked vertically on lightly branching stems that reach up to 3'.  The aromatic leaves have one-inch stems, rounded bases and toothed margins.   Another common name in use is Hairy Pagoda Plant.
 Potted plants come in trays of 38 and ship when all plants in the tray are well-rooted and transit-ready, early May through June. Click here if you prefer to mix/match up to 6 species in a tray.
